From the east of the city of Kuvana, entering the sandy desert, traveling more than two hundred li, reaching the city of Nirnaya.
Again, from here east, entering the great sandy desert, the wind moves the flowing sand, the ground has no water or grass, with many dangers of heat, poison, and evil spirits.
There is no road, travelers go back and forth, looking at the remains of people and animals as a sign. The barrenness and difficulty of traversing are as described in the preface.
Traveling another four hundred li, reaching the ruins of the country of Tukhara.
Traveling another six hundred li, reaching the ruins of the country of Zhemaotana, which is the land of Jumo.
Going northeast for more than a thousand li, he reached the old country of Nabhapana, which was the land of Loulan, and then reached his own territory.
Having obtained saddles and horses, he released the envoys and horses from Khotan to return.
By imperial decree, they were rewarded for their service, but they all refused and left.
When they arrived at Shazhou, they again submitted a memorial.
At that time, the emperor was in the palace of Luoyang.

The memorial was presented, and knowing that the Dharma Master was gradually approaching, an edict was issued to Fang Xuanling, the Left Premier and Duke of Liang State, who was in charge of the Western Capital, to have the authorities welcome him.
The Dharma Master, hearing that the emperor wanted to punish the border regions, feared that he would be too slow to arrive in time, so he doubled his journey and suddenly arrived at Cao.

The government officials did not know how to receive him, and there was no time to set up the ceremonial procession, but those who heard about it naturally rushed to see him. The streets were filled with people watching and paying homage, and they could not move forward due to the crowds. Thus, he stayed overnight at Cao.
